parameters.name: MediaInsightsPipelineConfigurationArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the pipeline's configuration.

parameters.name: KinesisVideoStreamSourceRuntimeConfiguration
parameters.description: The runtime configuration for the Kinesis video stream source of the media insights pipeline. The streams in the source runtime configuration of a Kinesis video stream. (dict) --- The configuration settings for a stream. The ARN of the stream. FragmentNumber (string) --- The unique identifier of the fragment to begin processing. The streaming channel definition in the stream configuration. The number of channels in a streaming channel. ChannelDefinitions (list) --- The definitions of the channels in a streaming channel. (dict) --- Defines an audio channel in a Kinesis video stream. The channel ID. ParticipantRole (string) --- Specifies whether the audio in a channel belongs to the AGENT or CUSTOMER. Specifies the encoding of your input audio. Supported format: PCM (only signed 16-bit little-endian audio formats, which does not include WAV) For more information, see Media formats in the Amazon Transcribe Developer Guide. The sample rate of the input audio (in hertz). Low-quality audio, such as telephone audio, is typically around 8,000 Hz. High-quality audio typically ranges from 16,000 Hz to 48,000 Hz. Note that the sample rate you specify must match that of your audio. Valid Range: Minimum value of 8000. Maximum value of 48000.

nested_params.name: Streams
nested_params.description: The streams in the source runtime configuration of a Kinesis video stream.

nested_params.name: StreamArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the stream.

nested_params.name: FragmentNumber
nested_params.description: The unique identifier of the fragment to begin processing.

nested_params.name: StreamChannelDefinition
nested_params.description: The streaming channel definition in the stream configuration.

nested_params.name: NumberOfChannels
nested_params.description: The number of channels in a streaming channel.

nested_params.name: ChannelDefinitions
nested_params.description: The definitions of the channels in a streaming channel.

nested_params.name: ChannelId
nested_params.description: The channel ID.

nested_params.name: ParticipantRole
nested_params.description: Specifies whether the audio in a channel belongs to the AGENT or CUSTOMER.

nested_params.name: MediaEncoding
nested_params.description: Specifies the encoding of your input audio. Supported format: PCM (only signed 16-bit little-endian audio formats, which does not include WAV) For more information, see Media formats in the Amazon Transcribe Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: MediaSampleRate
nested_params.description: The sample rate of the input audio (in hertz). Low-quality audio, such as telephone audio, is typically around 8,000 Hz. High-quality audio typically ranges from 16,000 Hz to 48,000 Hz. Note that the sample rate you specify must match that of your audio. Valid Range: Minimum value of 8000. Maximum value of 48000.

parameters.name: MediaInsightsRuntimeMetadata
parameters.description: The runtime metadata for the media insights pipeline. Consists of a key-value map of strings. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: KinesisVideoStreamRecordingSourceRuntimeConfiguration
parameters.description: The runtime configuration for the Kinesis video recording stream source. The stream or streams to be recorded. (dict) --- A structure that holds the settings for recording media. StreamArn (string) --- The ARN of the recording stream. Describes the timestamp range and timestamp origin of a range of fragments in the Kinesis video stream. The origin of the timestamps to use, Server or Producer. For more information, see StartSelectorType in the Amazon Kinesis Video Streams Developer Guide. The range of timestamps to return. The starting timestamp for the specified range. The ending timestamp for the specified range.

nested_params.name: Streams
nested_params.description: The stream or streams to be recorded.

nested_params.name: StreamArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the recording stream.

nested_params.name: FragmentSelector
nested_params.description: Describes the timestamp range and timestamp origin of a range of fragments in the Kinesis video stream.

nested_params.name: FragmentSelectorType
nested_params.description: The origin of the timestamps to use, Server or Producer. For more information, see StartSelectorType in the Amazon Kinesis Video Streams Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: TimestampRange
nested_params.description: The range of timestamps to return.

nested_params.name: StartTimestamp
nested_params.description: The starting timestamp for the specified range.

nested_params.name: EndTimestamp
nested_params.description: The ending timestamp for the specified range.

parameters.name: S3RecordingSinkRuntimeConfiguration
parameters.description: The runtime configuration for the S3 recording sink. If specified, the settings in this structure override any settings in S3RecordingSinkConfiguration. The URI of the S3 bucket used as the sink. The file format for the media files sent to the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: Destination
nested_params.description: The URI of the S3 bucket used as the sink.

nested_params.name: RecordingFileFormat
nested_params.description: The file format for the media files sent to the Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags assigned to the media insights pipeline. (dict) --- A key/value pair that grants users access to meeting resources. The key half of a tag. The value half of a tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key half of a tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value half of a tag.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the media insights pipeline request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.
